document_content.title: Referral to General Medicine for Evaluation of Persistent Fatigue

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Amelia Porter is being referred to General Medicine for assessment and management of persistent fatigue that has been ongoing for approximately four months.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports gradual onset of fatigue, which has progressively worsened. She describes feeling tired even after a full night’s sleep, with occasional headaches and mild muscle aches. No significant weight loss, fever, or night sweats. She denies chest pain, palpitations, or shortness of breath.

sections.heading: Past Medical History
sections.content: No known chronic illnesses. No previous surgeries. No history of anemia or thyroid disorders.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Occasional acetaminophen for headaches. No regular medications.

sections.heading: Social History
sections.content: Non-smoker, does not consume alcohol. Works as a graphic designer. No recent travel. Lives with spouse and one child.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: Vitals stable. Physical examination unremarkable; no lymphadenopathy, pallor, or organomegaly noted.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Basic blood work (CBC, metabolic panel, TSH) performed last week was within normal limits.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the persistence of symptoms despite normal initial investigations, further assessment is requested to rule out less common causes of fatigue. Your evaluation and recommendations would be appreciated.
